description: Access Point cold boot.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
The MAC address of the Access Point.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr

description: Invalid SNMP Community string.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
- apAPMacAddr is the MAC address of the remote host
sending SNMP packet with invalid community.

event.Summary: Host $v2 authentication failed due to invalid SNMP community string

description: The MAC address of the Access Point.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr

description: Mac Address of this Known AP.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apAPMacAddr

description: RF Driver is up.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
The MAC address of the Access Point.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr

description: Mobile Unit MAC address not in the Access control
Table.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
- muMacAddr is the MAC address of the Mobile Unit
not in the Access Control Table.

event.Summary: Mobile unit MAC address $v2 is not present in access control table

description: The MAC address of the Access Point.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr

description: The MAC address of the MU associated with this AP.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::muMacAddr

description: An Access Point with the same AP-ID with this Access
Point is found.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
The MAC address of the Access Point.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr

description: Indicates that there is one Mobile Unit associating
with this Access Point.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
- muMacAddr is the MAC address of the Mobile Unit.
Note : If two or more Mobile Units associate with the
Access Point at the same time, muMacAddr
belongs to the last Mobile Unit.
- apCurrentMUs is the number of Mobile Units currently
associating with this Access Point.

event.Summary: Mobile unit $v2 associated with access point $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMUAssocTrap SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr s EXAMPLE SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::muMacAddr s EXAMPLE SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apCurrentMUs c 9999

description: The MAC address of the Access Point.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr

description: The MAC address of the MU associated with this AP.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::muMacAddr

description: Indicates the number of MUs currently associated with
this AP.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apCurrentMUs

description: Indicates that there is one Mobile Unit no longer
associating with this Access Point anymore.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
- muMacAddr is the MAC address of the Mobile Unit.
Note : If two or more Mobile Units un-associate with
the Access Point at the same time, muMacAddr
belongs to the last Mobile Unit.
- apCurrentMUs is the number of Mobile Units currently
associating with this Access Point.

event.Summary: Mobile unit $v2 is not associated with access point $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMUUnAssocTrap SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr s EXAMPLE SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::muMacAddr s EXAMPLE SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apCurrentMUs c 9999

description: The MAC address of the Access Point.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr

description: The MAC address of the MU associated with this AP.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::muMacAddr

description: Indicates the number of MUs currently associated with
this AP.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apCurrentMUs

description: Indicates that the Mobile Unit changes from PSP mode
to CAM mode.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
- muMacAddr is the MAC address of the Mobile Unit.
Note : If two or more Mobile Units change their mode
at the same time, muMacAddr belongs to the
last Mobile Unit.
- apCurrentMUs is the number of Mobile Units currently
associating with this Access Point.

event.Summary: Mobile unit $v2 changes from PSP mode to CAM mode

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMUToCAMTrap SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr s EXAMPLE SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::muMacAddr s EXAMPLE SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apCurrentMUs c 9999

description: The MAC address of the Access Point.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr

description: The MAC address of the MU associated with this AP.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::muMacAddr

description: Indicates the number of MUs currently associated with
this AP.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apCurrentMUs

description: Indicates that the Mobile Unit changes from CAM mode
to PSP mode.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
- muMacAddr is the MAC address of the Mobile Unit.
Note : If two or more Mobile Units change their mode
at the same time, muMacAddr belongs to the
last Mobile Unit.
- apCurrentMUs is the number of Mobile Units currently
associating with this Access Point.

event.Summary: Mobile unit $v2 changes from CAM mode to PSP mode

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMUToPSPTrap SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr s EXAMPLE SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::muMacAddr s EXAMPLE SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apCurrentMUs c 9999

description: Indicates that the Root AP connection is setup and
is ready to forward data.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
- apAPMacAddr is the MAC address of the Root AP.
- apNbrOfWLAPItfs is the number of current WLAP
Interfaces established.

event.Summary: Root wireless AP $v1 connection is up

description: The MAC address of the Access Point.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr

description: Mac Address of this Known AP.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apAPMacAddr

description: Indicates number of WLAP interfaces established.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apNbrOfWLAPItfs

description: If the current wireless AP does not receive Beacon
packet from its Root AP within one second, it will
consider the Root AP is lost. The wireless AP will
eventually reset itself to re-establish the network
topology.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
- apAPMacAddr is the MAC address of the Root AP.
- apNbrOfWLAPItfs is the number of current WLAP
Interfaces established.
The MAC address of the Access Point.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr

description: Mac Address of this Known AP.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apAPMacAddr

description: Indicates number of WLAP interfaces established.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apNbrOfWLAPItfs

description: Indicates that the Designated WLAP connection is setup
and is ready to forward data.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
- apAPMacAddr is the MAC address of the Designated
WLAP.
- apNbrOfWLAPItfs is the number of current WLAP
Interfaces established.
The MAC address of the Access Point.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr

description: Mac Address of this Known AP.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apAPMacAddr

description: Indicates number of WLAP interfaces established.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apNbrOfWLAPItfs

description: If the current wireless AP does not receive Config BPDU
(Bridge Protocol Data Unit) packet from its Designated
WLAP for MAX AGE time, it will consider that the
Designated WLAP is lost.
- apMyMacAddr is the MAC address of the Access Point
sending this trap message.
- apAPMacAddr is the MAC address of the Designated
WLAP.
- apNbrOfWLAPItfs is the number of current WLAP
Interfaces established.
The MAC address of the Access Point.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apMyMacAddr

description: Mac Address of this Known AP.
variables.name: SYMBOL-ENTERPRISE-PRIVATE-MIB::apAPMacAddr

description: Indicates number of WLAP interfaces established.
